title: Ticket #4467: starter heap corruption on windows while creating execute dir
description:
Cycle Computing has reported on condor users that starters are exiting with status -1073740940 (0xC0000374) which is STATUS_HEAP_CORRUPTION

The crash is happening just after creation of the execute directory and before the job is started. The last lines in the StarterLog are. There is no core file. 

07/10/14 17:48:47 (fd:7) (pid:336) (D_ALWAYS) setting the orig job name in starter
07/10/14 17:48:47 (fd:7) (pid:336) (D_ALWAYS) setting the orig job iwd in starter
07/10/14 17:48:47 (fd:7) (pid:336) (D_PRIV) PRIV_CONDOR --> PRIV_CONDOR at c:\condor\execute\dir_18128\userdir\src\condor_starter.v6.1\basestarter.cpp:1789

Some experimentation shows that the problem only happens when the starter is built with the Visual Studio 2012 compiler.

2014-Jul-17 21:24:59 by johnkn:
the code at src\condor_utils\perm.windows.cpp line 882 is 

	// clean up our memory.
	LocalFree(oldDACL);
	LocalFree(newDACL);

And sure enough oldDACL is not a pointer to the start of a heap allocation. The mystery is why this code doesn't crash in VS2008.

2014-Aug-06 15:24:49 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Looks good. I am just committing a small change that adds some comments in the code to help future folks understand the crazy structs returned by Windows.
